Dear Senators bought and paid for by the gun lobby,
I‚Äôm happy you are all having such lovely summer vacations, but just a reminder: while you are enjoying your time at home, more people are going to be slaughtered in preventable shootings around the country. More Americans will buy guns that allow the average person to become a killing machine. More mothers and fathers will never get to tell their children ‚ÄúI love you‚Äù for the last time. More children will never get to grow up. More people of color will be targeted by white supremacists fueled by the hateful rhetoric of our president. And by deciding not to take immediate action after the horror El Paso, Chicago, and Dayton have suffered this week (along with many other U.S. cities) you are sending us a clear message that you continue to reiterate‚Äî Blood money and vacations matter more than our lives. Please end your recess and take an emergency vote on gun safety NOW. #endgunviolence #enoughisenough #enough #neveragain #gunviolence #gunsense #gunreformnow

Launched today‚ÄîBlack Girl 44 Scholarship! blackgirl44.com ‚ú®üíÉüèΩ‚ú®.
.
.
The Black Girl 44 Scholarship was created by former Obama White House alum Deesha Dyer @deedyer267 and includes contributions from more than 55 Black / African-American women who worked in the Obama White House. This private and independent initiative will award three $1,500 scholarships to Black/African-American women college students who have earned a Washington, D.C. internship that relates to policy, community engagement, community service, advocacy, global relations or politics for Fall 2019. .
Scholarship recipients will be chosen from an application process that runs from June 19 to July 31, 2019. Winners will be notified in August and they will receive their scholarship award at a September luncheon in Washington, D.C. The eligibility requirements and application can be found at blackgirl44.com. Questions? Email info@blackgirl44.com.
.

Today, on International Day of the Girl, we observe the importance of empowering young women and raise awareness of the gender inequality faced by girls around the world.The Global Girls‚Äô Bill of Rights was created for the 2019 International Day of the Girl, and was presented yesterday to the United Nations. This declaration proclaims 10 of the basic rights all girls deserve:
.
1. free, quality education which prepares them for the modern world
2. equality
3. involvement in decision-making and pursuit of leadership positions without fear of discrimination, harassment, or persecution
4. documentation
5. comprehensive sexual education and access to free, quality reproductive healthcare
6. protection from harmful traditions and enjoyment of positive cultural practices
7. safety from all forms of violence
8. decision-making about their body and sexuality
9. protection under the law without fear or unequal treatment
10. freedom from exploitation
.
Please celebrate this day by supporting every girl‚Äôs access and entitlement to these rights, and continue to uplift the young women in your life. #GIRLPOWER üí™üèøüí™üèæüí™üèΩüí™üèºüí™üèª

Last week I, along with @mom2summit @jillkraus.e, went to the Val Verde Border Humanitarian Coalition to unpack boxes of donations, bear witness and get to know the hard-working volunteers. As our friend Jill Krause wrote on her blog, ‚ÄúSeeing anger and sadness and all these other feelings we‚Äôve all been feeling turned into ACTION was a powerful experience. ‚Äú
We watched as volunteers welcomed families and gave backpacks to them filled with supplies. We saw the relief on the faces of parents who were able to give food, toys and clean clothes to their children. We witnessed our shared humanity.
There are so many good-hearted people wanting to help. Here are a few things you can do: Learn more about why people are here asking for asylum. Follow @vvbhcoalition on Instagram and donate via their Amazon Wishlist. They need a lot, especially shoes.
Be a peacemaker. - Meredith Walker, Smart Girls Cofounder
